alert.note: Alert for Pike (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued June 16 at 10:01PM CDT until June 16 at 10:45PM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: The National Weather Service in Birmingham has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Pike County in southeastern Alabama... * Until 1045 PM CDT. * At 1000 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Troy Municipal Airport, or near Troy, moving southeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Troy, Brundidge, Goshen, Banks, Antioch, Linwood, Ansley, Troy Municipal Airport, Troy University, Tennille, Hamilton Crossroads, Monticello, Orion, Springhill, Sandfield, Tarentum, Brundidge Municipal Airport, Mossy Grove and Henderson. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
